intro: Disciphania killipii, commonly known as Killip's disciphania, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in late spring. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in a fine, velvety texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
